title: Derivative of Inverse Trigonometric Functions:sec(x)
text: The formula for the derivative of inverse sec(x) is $$\frac{d}{dx} {sec}^{-1} x=\frac{1}{|x| \sqrt{x^2-1}}$$.

title: Applying the Chain Rule
text: Because the inverse of sec has a function inside its parentheses, $$\frac{1}{x}$$ in this case, we need to apply the chain rule before using the formula from the previous hint. For reference, the chain rule is $$(f(g(x)))'=\operatorname{f'}\left(g{\left(x\right)}\right) \operatorname{g'}\left(x\right)$$.
